goal.ch:
2021-2030年是聯合國海洋永續發展的關鍵十年，本課程將讓學生了解到基礎的海洋物理及海洋化學知識，讓學生足夠理解全球海洋的性質和特徵。海洋學是一門科學，專注於解釋水在地球各個部分發生的所有物理和生物化學過程。描述性海洋學描述了海洋中水團的分佈和特徵和研究海洋中水的運動及其運動原因的部分；化學海洋學負責研究海水化學成分的部分及分析人類活動的排放而產生的水的化學組成發生的所有變化。本課程內容包括海洋地理、海洋循環、海洋數據分析及方法、大氣化學、海洋營養鹽及初級生產力、太平洋及大西洋的水體詳細特徵。最後本課程有兩週的MATLAB實作課程，讓同學們實際接觸到海洋基本性質與再分析資料的分層數據。

(本課程不限任何科系背景，歡迎大學部選修)
goal.en:
The United Nations has declared 2021-2030 as the Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development. This course will provide students with foundational knowledge of physical and chemical oceanography, enabling them to thoroughly understand the characteristics and nature of the global ocean. Oceanography is a science focused on explaining all the physical and biogeochemical processes that occur with water across different parts of Earth. Descriptive oceanography deals with the distribution and characteristics of water masses in the ocean and studies the motion of water and the reasons behind these movements. Chemical oceanography focuses on the study of the chemical composition of seawater and analyzes changes in water chemistry caused by human activities. The course content includes marine geography, ocean circulation, methods and analysis of ocean data, atmospheric chemistry, marine nutrients and primary productivity, and detailed characteristics of the Pacific and Atlantic waters. Lastly, the course features a two-week MATLAB practical session, allowing students to work hands-on with the basic properties of the ocean and stratified reanalysis data.

(This course does not require any specific departmental background and is open to all undergraduate students for elective credit.)
